adjective.description: Having a frizzy, fluffy, or frayed texture or appearance.
Difficult to perceive clearly or understand and explain precisely; indistinct or vague.
examples: that fuzzy line between right and wrong

adjective.description: Relating to a form of set theory and logic in which predicates may have degrees of applicability, rather than simply being true or false. It has important uses in artificial intelligence and the design of control systems.
